snippet: The advance of Islamic State forces on Kobani, Syria, has stalled as the militants have been forced to retreat on several fronts, shifting the monthlong battle in favor of the Kurdish fighters defending the city.
abstract: Islamic State forces have been forced to retreat on several fronts, stalling their march on Syrian city of Kobani and shifting battle in favor of Kurdish fighters who have been defending city in monthlong battle.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Suruc, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Suruc.

lead_paragraph: The advance of Islamic State forces on Kobani, Syria, has stalled as the militants have been forced to retreat on several fronts, shifting the monthlong battle in favor of the Kurdish fighters defending the city.

headline.main: ISIS Militants in Syrian Border Town Begin to Retreat After a Monthlong Battle
headline.print_headline: Militants in Syrian Border Town Begin to Retreat After a Monthlong Battle
